wikipedia_page.main: Galfred Francis Congreve (also Galfrid; 16 July 1849 – 10 February 1882) was an amateur sportsman who played for Scotland in the second representative match against England in 1870.

response: In 1856, he married Mary, daughter of John Bury of Warwick. He may or may not be related to Galfred Congreve.
* Galfred Congreve (fl. 1850–1881), Scottish amateur footballer and cricketer, later a civil servant
* Galfred Congreve (fl. 1850–1881), Scottish amateur footballer and cricketer, later a civil servant
